byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Community leaders in Cleveland will invoke little-used Ohio law and go straight to judge to ask for murder charges against police officers involved in fatal 2014 shooting of 12-year-old Tamir Rice, rather than waiting for authorities to take action; unusual move underscores indication that some blacks in city and around country have lost belief in criminal justice system they view as too quick to support police accused of using excessive force against blacks.
lead_paragraph: Community leaders will invoke a seldom-used Ohio law and go directly to a judge to request murder charges against the police officers in the shooting.

headline.main: Cleveland Leaders Bypass Prosecutors to Seek Charge in Tamir Rice Case
headline.print_headline: A Rare Gambit Seeking Justice for a Shot Boy

snippet: Community leaders will invoke a seldom-used Ohio law and go directly to a judge to request murder charges against the police officers in the shooting.
